transportAdvice: The city centre and waterfront areas are walkable, making it easy to explore key attractions on foot; public buses connect the centre to beaches, suburbs, and the wider metropolitan area. Taxis are readily available at stands near the port, airport, and main squares, and are a reliable option for reaching areas less well served by public transit.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally wet with mild temperatures, making it a quiet off-season month good for sightseeing without crowds.
Similar to January with gradually lengthening days; rain showers are possible but the city remains pleasant and uncrowded.
Spring begins to arrive with warmer afternoons and occasional rain; a good time for outdoor exploration before peak season.
Mild and increasingly sunny with comfortable temperatures ideal for walking, sightseeing, and early beach visits.
Warm and largely dry with long sunny days; beaches begin to open and the city feels lively without summer crowds.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; excellent beach weather and a vibrant atmosphere as the tourist season picks up.
Peak summer heat with intense sunshine and virtually no rain; beaches are busy and evenings are warm and lively.
The hottest and busiest month with crowded beaches and high accommodation demand; sea temperatures are at their warmest.
Warm and still largely sunny with the summer crowds thinning; a popular month for a more relaxed beach and city experience.
Mild autumn temperatures with increasing cloud and occasional rain; good for cultural visits and outdoor dining.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn deepens; the city is quiet and authentic, with fewer tourists and lower prices.
Cool and sometimes rainy with a festive atmosphere in the city centre; mild enough for comfortable daytime sightseeing.
